metadata.Title: CVE-2023-20867 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
A fully compromised ESXi host can force VMware Tools to fail to authenticate host-to-guest operations, impacting the confidentiality and integrity of the guest virtual machine.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-20867` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

open-vm-tools - 2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.2
open-vm-tools-containerinfo - 2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.2
open-vm-tools-desktop - 2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.2
open-vm-tools-salt-minion - 2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.2
open-vm-tools-sdmp - 2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream, this is a low-severity issue an attacker must have root access on the host to exploit the guest, which doesn't really give any extra privileges

criterions.comment: open-vm-tools package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:12.1.5-3~ubuntu0.22.04.2').
